articles.title: Party for Korean schoolchildren from Japan
articles.content:
Party for Korean schoolchildren from Japan

   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- A party arranged by the 
great leader comrade Kim Jong Il for the art group of Korean 
schoolchildren in Japan was held at the Mansudae Art Theatre 
on Monday evening.
   Attending the party were Kim Su Jin, director of the 
education department of the central standing committee of 
the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan 
(Chongryon), and members of the art group of Korean 
schoolchildren in Japan led by Kim Sun Chol, a section chief 
of the central standing committee of Chongryon, staying in 
the socialist fatherland.
   Kim Su Ik, general director of the general bureau of 
reception for overseas compatriots, Kim Song Chol, secretary 
of the central committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth 
League, and other officials concerned were also present.
   Speeches were made at the party.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun blames Kim Young Sam group for increased tension in Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun blames Kim Young Sam group for increased tension in Korea
   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today 
comments on the South Korean puppets' shameless allegation 
that the north's "military threat" has increased tension in 
the Korean peninsula.
   The traitor Kim Young Sam of South Korea recently invited 
the U.S. ambassador, the commander of the U.S.-South Korea 
combined forces and other americans in South Korea to 
"Chongwadae" and discussed the north's "possible 
provocation".
   Though the South Korean puppets have clamoured about the 
"threat from the north" for several dozen years, it has 
never existed, the daily says, and continues:
   The Kim Young Sam group of warmongers, who have sought 
confrontation and war against the north in league with 
aggressive outsiders, are the very one that heightened 
tension in the Korean peninsula and brought inter-Korean 
relations to the worst phase.
   Kim Young Sam said, "The problem between the north and 
the south can be resolved only by military strength." 
worse still, he has encouraged the South Koreans to regard 
the compatriots in the north as "enemy", not as fellow 
countrymen. 
   The puppets have expanded confrontation with the north 
outside South Korea. They even officially announced that 
they would totally sever inter-Korean ties.
   All the facts indicate that their call for "Improvement 
of inter-Korean relations", "dialogue" and "peaceful 
unification" is nothing but a trick to camouflage their 
bellicose nature as traitors and separatists.
   With no trick, however, can they flee from the 
responsibility for the situation of the peninsula, which has 
been driven to the brink of war.

articles.title: Powder-reeking behaviour of warmaniacs
articles.content:
Powder-reeking behaviour of warmaniacs
   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The South Korean puppets 
are driving the situation of the Korean peninsula to a phase 
of acute confrontation and war from the beginning of the new 
year.
   This was illustrated by the January 4 call of the puppet 
defence minister Kim Tong Jin and other military brasshats 
at a frontline unit in the central sector of the front to 
"Examine" the "Winter-time operational preparedness".
   Earlier, the South Korean puppets carried out a large-
scale war rehearsal on the plea of coping with "North's 
infiltration" and "Provocation".
   These are very ill-boding military moves. 
   Underlying the moves is a dangerous intrigue to find a 
way out of the deep-going political crisis in war 
provocation.
   The "Civilian government", now in its last year in 
office, has been isolated and rejected at home and abroad 
for its moves for confrontation and war and treacheries last 
year and has now sunk into a hopeless position.
   To cap it all, the people's struggle against the 
amendments to the "labour laws" and the "law on the agency 
for national security planning", which were rammed by the 
kim Young Sam group through the puppet "National assembly" 
at the end of last year, has gained in scope this year, 
sweeping Seoul, Kwangju, Inchon and other areas and driven 
the "civilian government" to a tight corner.
   In a bid to dampen the people's struggle against him, the 
traitor Kim Young Sam in his "nNew year address" called for 
"Labour-management harmony and compromise" and the "North-
south reconciliation and cooperation", but it was a trick 
to save the ruling crisis and prop up power.
   As his crafty trick did not work on the people, the 
traitor Kim Young Sam unprecedentedly manipulated the 
military brasshats to call at a frontline unit to "Examine" 
"operational preparedness" and raise outcries over 
"provocation" and "Infiltration" from the north.
   But, with such a clumsy drama, can the Kim Young Sam 
group never conceal their seamy side.
   The "civilian"-veiled warhawks, while advocating the 
"Inter-Korean closed-door policy", are trying to find their 
way out of "Government" crisis in provoking a new war. But, 
it is a foolish attempt. 
   Now the people and the people's army in the northern half 
of Korea are sharpening revolutionary vigilance against the 
puppets' war moves. 
   If the south Korean warmaniacs, bereft of reason, unleash 
a new war, we will annihilate them at a stroke.

articles.title: Public security men vow fulfilment of New Year'stasks
articles.content:
Public security men vow fulfilment of New Year'stasks
   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Public security men met on 
monday vowing to effect a fresh upswing in public security 
and people's security forces duties by carrying out the 
tasks outlined in the new year joint editorial of the 
newspapers Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun and Chongnyon 
Jonwi.
   At the meeting all the public security men and people's 
security forces soldiers were urged to make a breakthrough 
in the march under the slogan "Let us all become victors in 
this year's 'arduous march' " and take part in the final 
campaign to finish the "arduous march" victoriously, thus 
winning a new victory.
   They were encouraged to devotedly defend the respected 
general Kim Jong Il, supreme commander, and reliably 
safeguard the Korean people's singlehearted unity.
   They were also urged to keep a regular order available in 
society and further increase the units' combat capabilities.

articles.title: International Kothongryon issues bulletin
articles.content:
International Kothongryon issues bulletin
    Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The International United 
Confederation of Koreans (International Kothongryon) issued 
the fourth edition of the bulletin "Reunification".
   Under the title "Great principle for method of national 
reunification", the bulletin carried the part of national 
reunification in the New Year Address delivered by the 
great leader president Kim Il Sung on Jan. 1, 1991.
   It gave an account of the great leader comrade 
Kim Jong Il's on-site guidance to the work for building up 
mt. Chilbo as a pleasure ground for the people on Nov. 2, 
1996.
   The bulletin also printed an article and a song on 
comrade Kim Jong Suk, an indomitable communist revolutionary 
fighter.

articles.title: Lecture on 41st Sudanese Independence Day
articles.content:
Lecture on 41st Sudanese Independence Day
   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- A lecture to mark the 41st 
independence day of the sudan was held here Monday.
   The lecture was attended by the vice-chairman of the 
Korea-sudan friendship association, Ri Song Ho, who is also 
vice-chairman of the committee for cultural relations with 
foreign countries, members of the association and 
Pyongyangites.
   The vice-chairman gave a lecture on the subject "The 
sudan today".

articles.title: S. Koreans revere Secy. Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
S. Koreans revere Secy. Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The Sun Society in South 
Korea met on the evening of Dec. 30, 1996 to wish the great 
leader comrade Kim Jong Il good health and a long life and 
adopt a congratulatory message on the new year, according to 
the Seoul-based radio voice of national salvation quoting 
information from the seoul city committee of the national 
democratic front of South Korea.
   The message includes an article expressing reverence for 
general Kim Jong Il under the headlines of "A happy New Year 
1997" and "We wish general Kim Jong Il, the destiny of our 
nation, good health and a long life."
   The information said that similar meetings were held at 
some 20 ideology study circles in the city, including the 
Feb. 16 fellowship society, the saeppyol comrades-in-arms 
society and the independence society.

articles.title: S. Korean workers' struggle favored
articles.content:
S. Korean workers' struggle favored 
    Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Workers of the Pyongyang 
Coal Mining Machine Factory met on January 6 to denounce the 
kim Young Sam fascist clique for their criminal revision of 
the "labor laws" and the "law on the agency for national 
security planning".
   At the meeting the speakers said that the massive 
resistance of the South Korean workers and people of other 
social standings is a patriotic struggle for the abolition 
of the separatist and fascist laws and the realisation of 
national reunification through national reconciliation and 
unity and, at the same time, a righteous and just struggle 
to get rid of the chains of oppression and achieve true 
democracy and right to existence.
   Their death-defying resistance calling for the overthrow 
of Kim Young Sam is the eruption of wraths and resentment 
against the puppet who is notorious for treacheries and anti-
social crimes never witnessed before, they said, and 
expressed compatriotic support for them in their struggle.

articles.title: Floral baskets laid before portraits of  Pres. Kim Il Sung and Secy. Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral baskets laid before portraits of  Pres. Kim Il Sung and Secy. Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- Peter Persaud, leader of 
the Amerindian Action Movement of Guyana, and Fred 
Fredericks, chairman of the United Force of Guyana, 
respectively visited the DPRK embassy in Georgetown on Dec. 
31, 1996 and Jan. 1, 1997 and presented floral baskets 
before portraits of the great leaders President Kim Il Sung 
and comrade Kim Jong Il on the New Year.
   They sincerely wished comrade Kim Jong Il good health and 
a long life.
   Terence A. Marryshow, political leader of the Maurice 
Bishop Patriotic Movement of Grenada, and S. Aman, general 
secretary of the United National Congress of Trinidad and 
Tobago, visited the embassy  on Jan. 1 and presented floral 
baskets before portraits of president  Kim Il Sung and 
comrade Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans' orgs vow to launch vigorous struggle for national reunification
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans' orgs vow to launch vigorous struggle for national reunification
   Moscow, January 5 (KCNA) -- A meeting was co-sponsored in 
Moscow on new year's day by the united confederation of 
Koreans in Russia, the united confederation of Koreans in 
Moscow and the Korean veterans committee in Moscow.
   The participants laid floral baskets and bunches of 
flowers before a full-length figure portrait of the great 
leader president Kim Il Sung and prayed for his eternal 
life.
   The speakers said at the meeting that, since they have 
the great leader comrade Kim Jong Il, the people in the 
homeland would, in the new year, too, dynamically advance in 
the spirit of the "Arduous march" and the revolutionary 
spirit of soldiers and open up a bright vista for the 
homeland's prosperity.
   They expressed firm determination to vigorously launch 
the struggle for realizing national reunification by means 
of confederation based on the principle of independence, 
peaceful reunification and great national unity, which was 
put forward by president Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: South Korea: 200,000 workers go on strike "government" forsaken by people bound to ruin
articles.content:
South Korea: 200,000 workers go on strike 
   Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- South Korea's 
"Confederation of Trade Unions", known as Minju Rochong, 
held a rally against the amended "laws on labor affairs and 
the agency for national security planning" in Seoul on 
monday with unionists under its umbrella, citizens and 
students, more than 9,000 in all, present, a seoul-based 
radio reported.
   A resolution adopted at the rally warned that if the 
traitor Kim Young Sam does not repeal the "labor law" at a 
"New year press conference" slated today, trade unions of 
the public sector would join strikes.
   Minju rochong announced that some 200,000 workers of 
about 170 unions went on the second stage of general 
strikes as of January 6.
   At a press conference Minju Rochong vowed that if the 
"Labor law" was not abolished, it would expand the general 
strikes into  an all-people resistance for the 
disorganization of the "New Korea Party".
   Meanwhile, another labor group, "Federation of Korean 
Trade Unions", held rallies in Seoul, Pusan, Taejon, Inchon 
and three other major areas of South Korea on sunday to have 
the "labor law" nullified, and the all-people measure 
committee for democracy also had a rally in seoul against 
the amended "laws".
   A foreign media report from seoul said South Korea's 
major auto makers -- Hyundai, Kia, Daewoo, Ssangryong and 
Asia --  and Hyundai ship factories have still been idled by 
strikes.
